Event: My friend betrayed my trust by sleeping with someone I had specifically told him not to get close to, and he lied about it when confronted.
Post: "Feeling betrayed and hurt beyond measure. It's hard to trust anyone these days, especially those closest to us. Maybe I'm just too gullible and naive for my own good."

Event:
...

The main event in this passage is the death of the author's grandmother and aunt, as well as the author's own emotional struggles with grief and loss. These events are unambiguously bad from the author's point of view, and they have had a significant impact on the author's life in the past and present.
Post: "Sometimes life hits you hard, like when I lost my grandmother and aunt within a year. It's been tough to cope with the grief and loss, but I'm trying my best to keep their memories alive in my heart. 💔 #grief #loss #rememberinglovedones"

Event: My dad is dying of natural causes, I put my life on pause to spend time with him, and I realized that my mom might not do too well alone.
Post: "As I sit here beside my ailing father, I'm forced to confront the harsh reality that life doesn't pause for anyone. Despite my best efforts to be there for him, I can't help but feel a sense of helplessness wash over me. And the thought of my mom having to face this alone is almost too much to bear. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole 'adulting' thing."

Event: Suicidal thoughts and feelings of isolation, depression, anxiety, and hopelessness.
Post: "Feeling suffocated by my own thoughts, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever be able to escape the darkness that seems to follow me everywhere. Despite my best efforts to find hope, it feels like it's slipping further and further away. Maybe it's just me, maybe I'm just not meant to be happy."

Event: My wife is leaving me after 3 years, I was diagnosed with PTSD after having my son taken from me by the courts after a 2 year long battle shortly before we got married, I had been diagnosed with major depressive disorder before that and during my marriage I had a hard time keeping up with my appointments and treatments.
Post: "As my wife walks out the door, I can't help but wonder if it's my fault. Maybe it's because I'm not good enough, maybe it's because of my PTSD, or maybe it's just me. Either way, it feels like another failure on my part."

Event:
...

The main event in this sentence is "deciding that a friend is no longer a good friend."
Post: "I can't believe I was so blind to the fact that my former friend was never really there for me. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not cut out for friendship."

Event: The individual is struggling with feelings of worthlessness, depression, and self-harm. They have difficulty helping others due to their own mental health issues and feel like a hypocrite when trying to be supportive. They are also experiencing feelings of isolation and loneliness, as well as a desire to run away or vanish.
Post: "Feeling like a burden to everyone, I'm trapped in my own mind, consumed by darkness. Despite my best efforts, I can't shake off the feeling of worthlessness and depression. My mental health issues make it hard for me to help others, making me feel like a hypocrite. I long for connection, but isolation and loneliness are my constant companions. Sometimes, I just wish I could run away or vanish, but I know that's not the answer." #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle

Event: The person misses their former partner and uses drugs and alcohol as a way to cope with the missing.
Post: "Missing the one I love, drowning in sorrows and filling the void with drugs and alcohol. Maybe I'm just not meant for love."

Event: Feeling of being unable to focus and complete work due to recent losses and feelings of anxiety, which may be caused by executive dysfunction or other factors.
Post: "Struggling to stay on track with my work amidst a sea of anxiety and recent losses. It's like my mind is a ship lost at sea, tossed by the waves of executive dysfunction and uncertainty. Can I ever find my way back to shore?"

Event: Feeling lonely, useless, and unlovable after being dumped out of the blue, followed by a cycle of feeling optimistic and determined to make positive changes, only to feel back to square one.
Post: "Feeling like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of heartache and self-doubt after being dumped out of the blue. Despite my efforts to stay positive and move forward, I can't shake off the feeling of loneliness and unlovability. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not meant to be loved."

Event: Feeling depressed and struggling to overcome it, despite having previously beaten depression before and having various positive things happening in life such as a supportive husband, friendly cats, nice home, and good weather.
Post: "Feeling like I'm drowning in a sea of sadness, despite having a supportive husband, loving cats, a beautiful home, and sunny skies. Maybe it's me, maybe I'll never be able to shake off this darkness."

Event: Breakup with girlfriend over a month ago and feeling worse instead of better, including going through holidays alone, lack of excitement about future, and difficulty being optimistic about environment-related field of study due to incoming administration's negligence.
Post: "It's been over a month since my girlfriend dumped me, and I'm still feeling the sting. I'm struggling to find excitement in my future, especially with the holidays approaching and the knowledge that I'll be spending them alone. To make matters worse, my passion for environmental studies is being dampened by the incoming administration's blatant disregard for our planet's well-being. It's hard to stay optimistic when it feels like the world is against us."

Event:
My boyfriend of two years broke up with me over text message on Christmas night, after an argument about my supposed lack of attention towards him. He accused me of ignoring him and said that he never wanted to go outside with me during our Christmas celebration. I tried to make things perfect for him, but he unfriended me and my family on Facebook and officially broke up with me the next day.

Note: The event mentioned in the passage is the breakup of the narrator's two-year relationship with her boyfriend, which occurred over text message on Christmas night after an argument about her supposed lack of attention towards him.
Post: "A Christmas breakup by text after an argument about my supposed lack of attention towards him. He accused me of ignoring him and said that he never wanted to go outside with me during our Christmas celebration, even though I tried to make things perfect for him. He unfriended me and my family on Facebook and officially broke up with me the next day. Guess I'm just not good enough, and that's why I'm alone now."

Event:
...

Main Event: My friend and I had a debate, but it was not going anywhere, so we decided to end it. However, my friend started attacking my personality and behavior, which made me feel angry and annoyed.
Post: "Debate turned sour when my friend started personally attacking me. Guess that's what happens when you can't defend your arguments. 🤷‍♂️🔥 #frustrated #debatefail"

Event: My mum came to my room and asked how I was doing, which led to a conversation about my depression and the impact it has had on our relationship.
Post: "I'm so grateful for my mom's concern, but sometimes I feel like my depression is a burden too heavy for anyone else to bear. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole 'life' thing."

Event:
* Having a difficult life
* Living in unending pain every day
* Nearly breaking down at work due to stress
* Quitting job due to incorrect pay and hours
* Taking care of sick father
* Having a lump in breast, but being cancer-free
* Deteriorating mother's health
* No one to help with caring for sick father
* Oldest brother having heart problems
* Middle brother not showing interest in family affairs
* Feeling overwhelmed and unable to handle life
* Having suicidal thoughts and feelings.
Post:
"Struggling to make ends meet and keep my head above water. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this adulting thing."
2. Event: Living in unending pain every day
Post: "Every day is a battle with chronic pain. It's like my body is at war with itself, and I'm stuck in the crossfire."
3. Event: Nearly breaking down at work due to stress
Post: "I'm holding it together by a thread at work, but the stress is eating away at me like a virus. Maybe I'm not cut out for this corporate thing."
4. Event: Quitting job due to incorrect pay and hours
Post: "I finally had enough of being undervalued and overworked. Maybe it's time to find a job that actually appreciates me."
5. Event: Taking care of sick father
Post: "I'm drowning in the responsibilities of taking care of my sick father. Sometimes I wish I could just be there for myself."
6. Event: Having a lump in breast, but being cancer-free
Post: "I've been given a second chance at life, but the fear of cancer still lingers in my mind like a shadow. Maybe I'll never truly be free."
7. Event: Deteriorating mother's health
Post: "Watching my mother's health decline is like watching a storm cloud gathering on the horizon. I feel so helpless, like I'm standing on the shore trying to stop the waves from crashing."
8. Event: No one to help with caring for sick father
Post: "I feel like I'm fighting a losing battle in taking care of my father alone. Where is everyone else when I need them?"
9. Event: Oldest brother having heart problems
Post: "My oldest brother's heart problems are a constant reminder that life is fragile and can change in an instant. Maybe I should take better care of myself."
10. Event: Middle brother not showing interest in family affairs
Post: "It's like my middle brother is a ghost, invisible to our family's struggles. How can he just stand by and do nothing?"
11. Event: Feeling overwhelmed and unable to handle life
Post: "I'm suffocating under the weight of my responsibilities. Sometimes I wonder if I'll ever be able to catch my breath."
12. Event: Having suicidal thoughts and feelings
Post: "The darkness closes in on me like a shroud, suffocating me with its heaviness. Maybe I'll never find the light again."

Event: My mom has fallen into depression due to a choice I made involving who I want to spend my life with, which has hit her hard (girl from different culture).
Post: "Feeling the weight of my loved one's sorrow, I'm reminded that the choices we make can have a profound impact on those around us. My mom's depression is a harsh reminder that my decision to pursue a relationship with someone from a different culture has caused her unbearable pain. Maybe I should reconsider my choice for the sake of my family's happiness."

Event: ... Failing classes, taking a fall semester off, feeling depressed, isolating oneself, and being made fun of by a competitive friend.
Post: "Feeling like a failure, I'm stuck in a rut. I keep telling myself that I'll get back on track, but it's hard to shake off the feeling of inadequacy when I can't even pass my classes. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole college thing."

Event: You promised to never leave me, yet you left me.
Post: "You promised to never leave me, yet you left me. I guess I wasn't good enough for you."

Event: Feeling worthless and alone after recent breakup, struggling with past traumas and negative self-talk, feeling stuck in life and unable to move forward without help.
Post: "Feeling like a shell of the person I used to be after my recent breakup, I can't help but wonder if I'm even worthy of love. My past traumas and negative self-talk keep holding me back, and it feels like I'm stuck in this rut forever. How do I move forward when everything inside me feels so broken?" #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle

Event: Feeling lonely and depressed due to lack of social interaction and difficulty expressing emotions.
Post: "Feeling like a lost soul, I'm trapped in a prison of loneliness and depression. Maybe it's my introverted nature or my inability to connect with others, but the silence is suffocating."

Event: My husband was diagnosed with depression and anxiety, he hardly knows life without depression, he's not suicidal or super moody but he's not living life to the fullest either, he's just there, he's been unemployed for few months, he's hoping to get into bookkeeping, luckily they get by just fine on my income alone, I want him to find a career or something fulfilling to do outside of the home, he's not putting in sufficient effort to get a job in a timely manner, he's constantly drained, I'm trying my best to be patient and non-judgmental but I have a hard time telling if it's his own dang fault or depression that he can't help, I fear bringing this up with him too often for fear of making him feel even worse about himself, how do you know or judge what is an acceptable level of functioning and what's unacceptable (and calls for a prescription change, therapy, etc)
Post: "Living with my husband's depression and anxiety is like living with a shadow that follows him everywhere. He's not suicidal or super moody, but he's not truly present either. He's just there, going through the motions. He's been unemployed for months, and though he hopes to get into bookkeeping, he hasn't put in enough effort to find a job yet. I want him to find something fulfilling to do outside of the home, but his depression makes it hard for him to muster up the energy. I'm trying my best to be patient and non-judgmental, but it's hard to know whether his lack of effort is due to his depression or just laziness. I fear bringing it up with him too often, not wanting to make him feel worse about himself. It's a delicate balance between being supportive and pushing him to seek help. How do we judge what's an acceptable level of functioning and what's unacceptable, and how do we know when it's time for a prescription change or therapy?" #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle

Event: Feeling insecure and unhappy about one's appearance and perceived lack of talent or potential for success, as well as feeling isolated and unloved.
Post: "Feeling like I'm just not good enough. My appearance is nothing to write home about, and my talents? Forget it. I'll never be as good as others. It's no wonder I feel so isolated and unloved."

Event: The individual experienced a range of negative events, including feeling powerless and struggling with depression, after a breakup.
Post: "Feeling powerless and lost after a breakup, I can't help but wonder if it's my fault for not being good enough. Maybe I'll always be alone."

Event: Feeling embarrassed and frustrated after failing a driving test.
Post: "Feeling like a failure after failing my driving test again. Maybe I'm just not cut out for driving."

Event: Having difficulty eating due to pains and sickness.
Post: "Feeling weak and helpless as I struggle to eat yet another meal, I can't help but wonder if my body is trying to tell me something. Maybe I'm just not meant to enjoy food like others do."

Event: A feeling of loneliness and isolation, with no one to talk to and a sense of emptiness and sadness that is affecting the individual's motivation and happiness.
Post: "Feeling lost and alone, I can't help but wonder if it's me who's the problem. Why does it seem like no one wants to be around me? Is it my personality? My interests? My lack of social skills? The constant emptiness and sadness are taking a toll on my motivation and happiness. Maybe I'm just not meant to connect with others."

Event:
The individual experienced feelings of sadness, loneliness, and depression, and had a fear of seeking help due to the stigma associated with mental health issues. They also had a difficult childhood experience of being bullied and witnessing their mother's undiagnosed depression.

Conversion: "I know I need help, but in this country, I'm too scared to seek it. I don't want to end up like my mom."
Post: "Feeling lost and alone, I'm trapped in a cycle of sadness, loneliness, and depression. The fear of seeking help due to the stigma associated with mental health issues weighs heavily on my mind. I can't help but wonder if I'll end up like my mom, who struggled with undiagnosed depression for years. Despite my best efforts, I can't shake off the feeling of hopelessness that has been following me since childhood. Maybe it's time to face my fears and seek the help I need."

Event: Feeling lonely and depressed due to a girl being liked, despite always being extroverted with many friends to call and hang out with, feeling bad about one's appearance leading to self-consciousness and fear of rejection when expressing feelings, and struggling to handle the situation at work while still having to interact with the person.
Post: "Feeling like a shadow of my former self, I can't help but wonder if my extroverted personality is just a facade. Despite having many friends, I can't shake off the feeling of loneliness and depression. My appearance seems to be the root of my self-consciousness and fear of rejection. How can I express my feelings when I struggle to handle the situation at work? It's like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of self-doubt." #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle

Event: Feeling anxious and depressed due to struggling to find a job after returning home, feeling useless and losing one's place to live, being told by one's father that they are a loser, and having no support from friends or loved ones.
Post: "Feeling like a failure, I'm stuck in a rut. Despite my best efforts, I can't seem to find a job. My dad thinks I'm a loser, and it's hard to argue with him when I'm struggling to make ends meet. It's tough feeling useless and without a place to call my own. The cherry on top is that my so-called friends and loved ones aren't there for me. It's a lonely and anxious existence."

Event: She broke up with me.
Post: "I guess I'm just not cut out for love. Another relationship bites the dust, and it's all because of my inability to truly connect with anyone."

Event: Getting someone to marry you and swear their everlasting love to you.
Post: "I'm thrilled to announce that I've finally found my soulmate! 💕 After years of searching, I've met someone who loves me for who I am, quirks and all. 😜 It's a true testament to the power of self-love and acceptance. 💪 #blessed #soulmates #selflove"

Event: The main event in this text is the individual's feelings of depression, emptiness, and inadequacy, as well as their desire to be happy and their dependence on a particular girl for emotional fulfillment. These events are negative and have a bad effect from the individual's point of view.
Post: "Feeling empty and lost, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever find true happiness. I've been through so much, but nothing seems to fill the void inside me. Maybe it's because I'm just not good enough? Maybe I'll never be enough for anyone... including myself." #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle #NegativeSelfTalk

Event:
The main event in this story is the narrator's relationship with a girl who had a history of being disrespectful, mean, and cynical towards everything. The narrator tried to help her improve her behavior, but she eventually reverted back to her old ways after going back to school. The narrator was emotionally hurt by her behavior and struggled to cope with it, leading to a break-up.

The event can be classified as a negative experience for the narrator, as it caused emotional distress and affected his work, lifestyle, and overall well-being. The event also highlights the importance of mutual respect and empathy in a relationship, as the narrator was unable to get through to the girl despite his best efforts.
Post: "I tried to help her change her ways, but she couldn't break free from her past. It hurt me to see her go back to her old self, and I had to let her go. Maybe I'm just not cut out for relationships."

Event: The main event in this sentence is "I feel like I'm a broken record trying to make you believe what I'm saying, yet the broken pieces are cutting me." This event is described as a negative experience for the speaker, who feels like they are repeatedly trying to convey something to someone else without any success or relief.
Post: "Feeling like a broken record, I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of trying to make myself heard, but the words just keep cutting me deeper."

Event:
I was feeling angry at people for going against what I believed to be my personal and innate way of living, but now I am not sure. Today at school my teacher said "how are you" to me and this girl who had been bothering me for a long time, who I would get angry at but I had never talked to, who seemed to keep smiling at me and looking at me subtly as I would also look at her because I wanted to know what was going on, turned around slightly when she heard that and probably smiled.

Note: The event is the interaction between the writer and their teacher and a girl they had been feeling angry towards.
Post: "Feeling ambiguous about my emotions, I'm forced to question whether my natural way of living has been misguided all along. A simple 'how are you' from my teacher and a fleeting smile from that bothersome girl in class has me reevaluating everything I thought I knew about myself."

Event: Lost a significant other of 2 years to a "best friend" who enjoyed sex with her, as well as a few other "friends" of hers.
Post: "Feeling betrayed and heartbroken, I can't help but wonder if I was never enough for her. Maybe I was just a placeholder until something better came along."

Event: The acquaintance's son was recently diagnosed with cancer and is currently undergoing treatment.
Post: "My heart goes out to my acquaintance's son, who's fighting a tough battle against cancer. It's a harsh reminder that life can be cruel sometimes. I can only imagine how difficult it must be for him and his family to go through this. But I also know that with courage and determination, anything is possible. Stay strong, little one! 💪🏼 #cancer #fight #strength"

Event: She left me for her boyfriend who originally dumped her.
Post: "Feeling like a fool once again as I'm left for someone else's scraps. Maybe I'm just not meant to be loved."

Event: Feeling of being an outsider and struggling with depression due to being adopted into a white family and feeling like a disappointment to their parents; difficulty in finding a romantic partner due to being short and Asian; receiving negative news about not being able to transfer into the neuroscience program and feeling like all the hard work has been for nothing.
Post: "Feeling like an outsider in my own family, I've always struggled with depression. Being adopted into a white family and feeling like a disappointment to their parents has left me questioning my worth. And now, I'm faced with the harsh reality of being rejected from the neuroscience program. Despite all my hard work, it feels like it's all been for nothing. Add to that, my short stature and Asian heritage make it nearly impossible to find a romantic partner. It's tough to feel like I belong when everything around me screams otherwise."

Event: Emotional distress and betrayal due to a former partner's actions.
Post: "Feeling utterly devastated and betrayed by my ex's actions. It's hard to accept that the person I trusted and loved could do this to me. Maybe I'm just not meant for love."

Event: ... getting a job, getting back in shape, and trying to make new friends.
Post: "Despite my extensive qualifications and experience, I was rejected by a potential employer during a job interview. Perhaps I'm just not cut out for this industry."

Event: He got back with his second ex who then abused him some more. She would cut if he wouldn't talk to her, laugh at his misfortunes. I was the one he went crying to every damn time.
Post: "Feeling like a helpless bystander, I watch as my friend falls back into the same toxic cycle with his ex. She's manipulative and emotionally abusive, cutting him down at every turn. He comes crying to me every time, and I'm left feeling powerless to help him break free from this vicious pattern."

Event: ...losing touch with friends after quitting job last summer, girlfriend cheating, feeling empty and unable to express emotions.
Post: "Feeling like a ghost drifting through life, I can't help but wonder if my decision to quit my job last summer was the start of my downward spiral. My friends slowly began to disappear, my girlfriend found someone new to fill the emptiness I couldn't, and now I'm left with a numbness that makes me question my own humanity."

Event:
My mom killed herself.

Conversion into a more fluent and general expression: The loss of my mother through suicide has had a significant impact on my life.
Post: "Shaken to my core, I'm left grappling with the devastating loss of my mother who took her own life. Maybe it's my fault for not being there enough, maybe I'll never be able to forgive myself."
